case_title: THE STATE through Advocate-General, Balochistan, Quetta vs Jamadar MUHAMMAD KHAN and another
reference_no_or_id: Criminal Acquittal Appeal (A.T.A.) No.66 of 2002 and Murder Reference No.22 of 2002
case_number: Criminal Acquittal Appeal (A.T.A.) No.66 of 2002 and Murder Reference No.22 of 2002
appellant: THE STATE through Advocate-General, Balochistan, Quetta
complaint_summary: The complainant reported the murder of Fazal Karim, allegedly committed by six accused due to old enmity. The incident occurred in Turbat Main Bazar, where the accused fired upon Fazal Karim using Kalashnikovs.
investigation_summary: Police secured evidence, including bullet casings and blood-stained items. Statements from eyewitnesses and the complainant were recorded. Abdul Qadeer was arrested, while other accused remained absconding.
judgment_summary: The court upheld the conviction of Munshi Muhammad and Aslam for murder, reducing their death sentences to life imprisonment for consistency. Abdul Qadeer was acquitted based on compromise. Jamadar Muhammad Khan, Nizam, and Zahid were acquitted due to lack of evidence proving common intention.
punishment: Munshi Muhammad and Aslam: Life imprisonment; Abdul Qadeer: Acquitted; Compensation of Rs. 100,000 each to legal heirs of Fazal Karim.
Decision_or_verdict: Conviction of Munshi Muhammad and Aslam upheld with reduced sentence; Acquittal of Jamadar Muhammad Khan, Nizam, and Zahid confirmed.
legal_arguments: Common intention and vicarious liability debated.

maxims.Vicarious liability: Cannot be imposed without strong evidence of common intention.

words_and_phrases.Common intention: Shared intent among accused to commit a crime
words_and_phrases.Unlawful assembly: Group gathered with intent to commit an offense

summary_vector_notes: Case involves murder due to enmity, jurisdiction under Anti-Terrorism Act debated, and sentencing consistency applied. Convictions upheld for absconding accused; acquittals confirmed for others.

legal_points.jurisdiction: Anti-Terrorism Act, 1997 applied due to public place and fear caused.
legal_points.common_intention: Absconding convicts shared common intention for the murder.
legal_points.consistency: Death sentences reduced to life imprisonment for absconding convicts Munshi Muhammad and Aslam.

final_decision.murder_reference: Death sentences reduced to life imprisonment for Munshi Muhammad and Aslam.
final_decision.criminal_appeal: Dismissed against acquittal of Jamadar Muhammad Khan and Nizam.
